Antemasque is an American rock group formed in 2014 by former members of At The Drive-In and The Mars Volta, Omar RodrÃƒÂ­guez-LÃƒÂ³pez and Cedric Bixler-Zavala. Some of their first tracks featured Red Hot Chili Peppers's Flea on bass and Dave Elitch on drums.[2][3] Both Flea and Elitch had previously played with The Mars Volta.[4] Despite initial reports to the contrary, Flea is not a member of the group but only played on a few tracks and let the band use his recording studio.[5]

On April 9, 2014 the project was announced, and they released their first single "4AM" on the same day.[1] Rolling Stone described the song as "a charging, punkish rocker with the sorts of squiggly noodling that both the Mars Volta guys and Flea have used as calling cards in their respective groups."[4] The next day, the band released a second song, "Hangin in the Lurch", on their bandcamp page which is described as a mixed of progressive rock and punk rock.[6] The song's description mentions that it will be released on an upcoming self-titled album.[7] Their third single "People Forget" was released on April 11, 2014.[8] On April 15, the band released their fourth single, "Drown All Your Witches".[9] The group's debut album, titled Antemasque, is scheduled to be released on July 15 on their own Nadie Sounds label.
